item.title: What is Docker? Docker Container and Types of Virtualization
item.description: Docker is an open-source platform that packages applications into containers, enabling them to run reliably across different environments. We’ll compare the differences and pros/cons of host virtualization, hypervisor virtualization, and container virtualization, and explore the efficiency and usage of Docker containers.

item.title: Private IP/Public IP? Private Network/Public Network? VPN?
item.description: Learn the differences between private and public IPs, the role of NAT (Network Address Translation), and how VPNs work. From the concept of private networks that solved IPv4 address exhaustion to NAT functions in routers and practical VPN use cases, we’ll explore the core concepts of networking.

item.title: Understanding Spring Dispatcher Servlet
item.description: Explains the Front Controller pattern and the complete request processing flow of how Dispatcher Servlet receives client requests and delegates them to appropriate controllers

item.title: Deep Dive into JVM (Java Virtual Machine) (2)
item.description: An in-depth analysis of JVM’s 4 core components and the 5 memory areas of Runtime Data Areas (Method, Heap, Stack, PC Register, Native Method Stack).

item.title: Deep Dive into JVM (Java Virtual Machine) (1)
item.description: A deep dive into the core concepts and operating principles of the Java Virtual Machine. Understand the complete process of how source code is converted to bytecode and executed as machine code through the JIT compiler.

item.title: Understanding Object-Oriented and Procedural Programming
item.description: Learn about the concepts, differences, and advantages/disadvantages of Object-Oriented Programming and Procedural Programming, and understand when to use each approach.
